item.description: Théa Ragon did her PhD at Géoazur - University Côte d’Azur from 2016 to 2019. She developed new approaches to better account for uncertainties in inverse problems, and earthquake studies in particular. She received the best 2019 Ph.D. award from University Côte d’Azur. She is now a post-doctoral fellow at the California Institute of Technology, USA.
